content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Monica are there as Joey is entering excitedly.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You guys! You’re not gonna believe this! I just got off the phone with my agent…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! (Joey looks at her.) I’m sorry, too soon. You go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. I got nominated for my part on Days of Our Lives !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good for you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Congratulations! Wow! I can’t believe you’re nominated for an Emmy !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh Soap Opera Digest award!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! I’m up for a Soapie!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey? Is that something you’re making up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no! It’s real! And it has been since 1998. (Rachel returns from the bathroom.) Hey Rach! Rach! I’m up for a Soapie!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God!! That is like the third most prestigious soap opera award there is!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you! Well, I guess now I know who I’m taking to the awards. (Points to Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, stop that! Don’t kid about that! (Gasps) Will all the stars be there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Many are scheduled to appear.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! I can’t go! I’m gonna be too nervous!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’ll go!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!! You are getting married! This is all I have.

content.description: N.Y.U, Ross is giving a lecture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …and it was Ernst Muhlbrat who first hypothesized that the Velociraptor would expand it’s collar and emit a high pitched noise to frighten it’s predator. (A student raises his hand.) Yes Mr. Lewis?

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: What kinda noise?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just a high pitched intimidating noise.

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: But like how?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well we-we don’t know for sure. But in my head it-it sounded something like this. (He makes a high pitched noise and Alan doesn’t know what to make of it.) Of course, this is just conjecture. Okay, that’s uh, that’s all for today. (Everyone starts to get up.) Uh Mr. Morse, can I see you for a moment?

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: Yes sir.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mr. Morse I need to talk to you about your mid-term exam, I’m afraid I-I had to fail you.

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well you need 60% to pass…

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: What’d I get?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Seven.

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: That’s not so good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no it’s not. What-what happened there Ned?

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: Well maybe you can cut me some slack. I’m sort of in love.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I’m sorry but, that-that’s really not my problem.

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: I’m in love with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well that brings me in the loop a little.

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: You see, that’s why I did so bad on this test. I’m having a hard time concentrating. When you’re up there (Points to the podium) and you’re teaching and your face gets all serious…you look so good. (In a sexy voice) You wear that tight little turtleneck sweater…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! (Walks away from him.) Umm, I uh, I’m your teacher. I’m sorry, you’re-you’re a student and I-and I like women. In spite of what may be written on the backs of some of these chairs.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe are drinking coffee and Phoebe notices a cute guy checking them out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! That guy at the counter is totally checking you out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? (Looks.) My God, he’s really cute.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Go for it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, I’m engaged!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just saying, get his number just in case. But no: Chandler is in an accident and can’t perform sexually and he would want you to take a lover to satisfy the needs that he can no longer fulfill.

content.speaker: The Cute Guy
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Op, can I just tell you something? Very flattered but umm, I’m engaged. (Points to her ring.)

content.speaker: The Cute Guy
content.text: Wow! Uh, this is kind of embarrassing. I was actually coming over to talk to your friend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well you should be embarrassed. (Leaves.)

content.speaker: The Cute Guy
content.text: I thought you knew I was looking at you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I did, but that was really fun.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting in the chair.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And the winner is…Joey Tribbiani! (He then gets excited and goes over to the counter to practice his acceptance speech using a bottle of maple syrup as the award.) Oh… Wow! I honestly never expected this. I uh, I didn’t prepare a speech. But umm, I’d like to thank (Rachel enters quietly) my parents, who’ve always been there for me. I’d also like to thank my friends, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, Rachel…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m fourth! (Joey is startled.) Look at you with your little maple syrup award!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah may-maybe you don’t tell anyone about this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? No! It’s not a big deal! I do that too, with my shampoo bottle.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What award are you practicing for?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Grammy , Best New Artist.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey listen! The Soapie’s called today, and I also get to present an award.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh that’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So you’ll definitely get onstage, even if you don’t win.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What you-you don’t think I’m gonna win?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well of course I do! But y’know, favorite returning character is a tough category Joey. I mean you’re up against the guy who survived his own cremation.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. No-no I-I know I might not win, but it’s just…I’ve never even been nominated before! I want it so much.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well Joey, you’ll probably get it. But you should probably start practicing your gracious loser face. Y’know when like the cameras are on you and you wanna look disappointed, but also that your colleague deserved to win. Y’know? So it’s sorta like… (Does it, you’ll have to see it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (Likes it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You practice losing the Grammies too?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, at the Grammies I always win.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah.

content.description: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, she’s cooking as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! How’d your date go with Jake?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, great! We couldn’t keep our eyes off each other all night and then every once and a while y’know, he’d kinda lean over and stroke my hair and touch my neck. (Does that to Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, stop it Phoebe, you’re getting me all tingly.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All I could think of was y’know, “Is he gonna kiss me? Is he gonna kiss me?”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And did he?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m a lady Monica, I don’t kiss and tell. But this hickey speaks for itself. (She starts to open up her blouse.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay-okay, I got it. I got it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just like him so much that I just feel like I’ve had 10 drinks today and I’ve only had six.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I haven’t had that feeling since I first started going out with Chandler. Wow, I’m never gonna have that feeling again, am I?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You sound like a guy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, a guy would be saying, “I’m never gonna get to sleep with anyone else.” Oh my God! I’m never gonna get to sleep with anyone else! I’ve been so busy planning the wedding that I forgot about all the things that I’d be giving up! I mean, I…I’m never gonna have a first kiss again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’ll have a last kiss.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Ross is helping Joey with his tie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can I ask you something? Have you ever had a guy have a crush on you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that why you wanted to tie my tie?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There’s this kid in my class who said he’s in love with me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross has a boyfriend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do-I do not have a boyfriend. There’s a guy in one of my classes who-who has a crush on me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! I don’t know. I mean, last year Elizabeth now-now this kid. What-what-what-what is it?! Am I giving out some kind of…sexy professor vibe? (Rachel and Joey both look at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It-it—The point is my natural charisma has made him fail his midterm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, see now I feel bad for the kid! I had a crush on a teacher once and it was so hard! Y’know you—I couldn’t concentrate and I blushed every time he looked at me. I mean come on, you remember what’s it’s like to be 19 and in love.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. I guess I can cut him some slack.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How’d you get over that teacher?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t. I got under him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Problem solved.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is saying good-bye to her boyfriend Jake at the door to Central Perk.

content.speaker: Jake
content.text: Bye Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay bye. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Jake
content.text: All right. Bye. (Backs out the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye! (Phoebe goes over and joins Monica on the couch.) We said good-bye at the door so as not to flaunt our new love.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, it’s okay. You don’t have to tip toe around me. I-I’ve been thinking about it and umm, y’know what? I’m okay about not having that new relationship feeling…

content.speaker: Jake
content.text: I miss you already!!
content.parenthetical: yelling through the window to Phoebe

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I miss you too!!!! (He walks away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See? That’s what I mean. I mean that , that’s great! But I wouldn’t trade in what I have for that. I mean I’m gonna be with Chandler for the rest of my life, and that’s what makes me happy. (Chandler approaches.) Hey sweetie, come here! Come sit down. Hey Phoebe and I were just talking about how our relationship is deep and meaningful. It really is, don’t you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh totally! (Holds up his finger.) Pull my finger.

content.description: The 2001 Soapie Awards, Joey’s category is up next and the presenter walks to the podium.

content.speaker: Announcer
content.text: Presenting the award for Favorite Returning Male Character is McKensize…
[Cut to Joey and Rachel’s table.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is it! This is my category.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know! My God! Do you have your speech?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I got my speech!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you got your gracious loser face?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. (Does it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now Joey remember, if you win you have to hug me! You hug me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Can I squeeze your ass?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: On TV?! Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ‘Kay!
[Cut to the presenter.]

content.speaker: The Presenter
content.text: …in the category of Favorite Returning Male Character the nominees are: John Wheeler from General Hospital (Applause), Gavin Grant from The Young and the Restless (Applause), Duncan Harrington from Passions (Applause), and Joey Tribbiani from Days of Our Lives (Applause). And the Soapie goes to…(She opens the envelope)…Gavin Grant from The Young and the Restless !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What the?! (Joey pounds the table and starts yelling at Rachel, and which is drowned out by applause. Rachel is desperately trying to tell Joey that he’s on TV right now. He finally notices and he does his gracious loser face.)

content.description: The 2001 Soapie Awards, the announcer is introducing the next presenter.

content.speaker: Announcer
content.text: Presenting the award for Favorite Supporting Actress is Joey Tribbiani from Days of Our Lives . (Applause as Joey angrily walks to the podium and eyes the trophy.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Any one of the brilliant actresses nominated for this award tonight deserves to take it home. Unfortunately only one can. (Shakes his head in disgust.) The nominees for Best Supporting Actress are: from Passions: Erin Goff. (There is applause, which Joey disgustedly waits to die out.) From One Life to Live: Mary Loren Bishop (They start to applaud again, but Joey interrupts in with the rest of the nominees), from All My Children: Sarah McCann, and from Days of Our Lives: Jessica Ashley. And the winner is…(Opens the envelope)…Jessica Ashley from Days of Our Lives . (Applause) Uh, unfortunately Jessica couldn’t be with us tonight, so I’ll be accepting this award on her behalf. (Realizes something) And I’m sure that Jessica would like to thank my parents who always believed in me. She’d also like to thank my friends, Chandler, Monica, Ross, Phoebe, and Rachel, who’s sittin’ right there! (Points at Rachel.) (The music starts and his microphone is turned off; this angers Joey again and he disgustedly exits.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Rachel are entering.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! Why did we have to rush out of there so fast?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach, we had to get out of there because: look what I won! (He whips out the award for Best Supporting Actress that he accepted for Jessica.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, you stole her award!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no! No, I’m accepting it on her behalf. (He puts it up above the TV to display it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey I don’t think you know what behalf means.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure I do! It’s a verb! As in, “I behalfin’ it!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, you have got to take this back!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But why?! I should’ve won one and I really want it, and she didn’t even care enough to come to the thing! It could also be a Grammy .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Rach! No one saw me take it! There was a whole table full of ‘em.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you really want an award you didn’t win?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! I want an award I did win! But nobody’s giving me any of those! Plus—Hey Rach, if-if I put it up there (Points to the TV) right? When people come over they’ll see it and they’ll think I won it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, it says Best Supporting Actress!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can scratch that right off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, no: this is wrong! You have to take it back, okay? You don’t want to win an award this way. You’re very talented. And someday you’re gonna win one of these for real, and that one is gonna mean something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right? (He sets the award down.) Thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll take it back tomorrow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.
(He goes into his room and closes the door. Rachel goes to pick it up and…)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If I can’t have it you can’t have it! (Rachel walks away angrily.)

content.description: Ross’s Classroom, he is writing on the board and Alan is coming in to see him.

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: Professor Geller?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes Mr. Lewis, how can I help you?

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: I know I didn’t do well on my midterms and stuff but, I was kinda hoping you could change my grade.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And why exactly would I do that? (Goes back to writing on the board.)

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: Because I’m in love with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!
content.parenthetical: turning around and dragging the chalk down the board

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: Yeah, I’m all…in love with you and stuff. So could you change my grade?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: Well why not? You changed Ned’s grade!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well that’s different! Okay? Because he, he was actually in love with me!

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: No he’s not! He’s totally yanking your chain! He’s done this with three other teachers!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: He’s got a girlfriend!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe someone would do that for a grade.

content.speaker: Lewis
content.text: I know! It’s awful. I love you.
(Ross glares at him.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on the couch as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you seen Chandler?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘Cause I just keep thinking about all these things that I’m not gonna have, and it’s freaking me out. I don’t know what to do about it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, don’t sweat it. (Looking around her.) Chandler is nowhere around so go ahead get it out of your system. That guy’s cute. (Points to a guy sitting behind Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! Come on, I’m serious! I just got to talk to him about all this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, that is the last thing you want to do!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because you’re marrying him!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You gotta help me out here Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I’ve never been engaged and I’ve never really been married, but I can only tell you what my mother told me. Whenever you have doubts or fears or anxieties about a relationship, do not communicate them to your husband.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So I’m not supposed to share my doubts and fears with the guy I’m gonna spend the rest of my life with?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is correct! Yes, you’re supposed to take all of that stuff and put it in a little box in your mind and then lock it up tight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Your mother told you this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The woman that got married a bunch of times and killed herself when you were 13?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! You’re right! Go! (Monica starts to leave.) Go tell Chandler! Hurry before it’s too late! Wait no! (Monica stops.) Does this also mean putting out doesn’t get you love? (Monica is shocked.)

content.description: Silvercup Studios, Joey and Rachel are there to give Jessica her award.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I cannot believe I’m gonna meet Jessica Ashley!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay wait-wait p-please be cool! Okay? I work with this woman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’m totally cool! (She coolly knocks on the door)

content.speaker: Jessica Ashley
content.text: Come in.
(The enter.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Jessica.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Jess.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, this is my friend Rachel.

content.speaker: Jessica Ashley
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ‘Sup? (Joey glares at her.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh listen, here’s your Soapie. I accepted it for ya. (Hands it to her.)

content.speaker: Jessica Ashley
content.text: Oh my God! I won! Do you have any idea what this means?! (She rolls her eyes and throws it onto the couch.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that-that-that’s it? You’re gonna, you’re gonna put it on your shelf or anything?

content.speaker: Jessica Ashley
content.text: No, I try to save that for real awards. Now, if you’ll excuse me. (She exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Take it back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Absolutely.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y-y-yeah! (As they start to leave, Rachel pauses and steals a vase with flowers in it.) Yeah you do. (They exit.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is talking to Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, as we get closer to the wedding, is there anything that you would like to talk about or share?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Well, I think the centerpieces are too big

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re wrong! The centerpieces are fine! Do you ever get scared at all?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kinda. They’re really big.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Doesn’t it ever just freak you out that-that you’re never gonna be with anybody new again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just, I love you so much. Just…It’s just sometimes it bothers me that I’m never gonna have that feeling. Y’know when you meet someone for the first time and it’s new and exciting? Y’know that rush?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No, see when I first meet somebody it’s uh it’s mostly panic, anxiety, and a great deal of sweating.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, but all right you’re a guy, does it not freak you that you’re never gonna sleep with anybody else?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sleeping with somebody new: anxiety, panic, and, I’m afraid, even more sweating.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Even with me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was dangerously dehydrated during the first six months of our relationship. (Monica laughs.) Look, for me the rush is knowing that we are gonna be together for the rest of our lives.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well yeah! But now that I know that you’re having these thoughts, I’m back to panic, anxiety, and uh I’m definitely gonna need some kind of sports drink.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come here! Come here! (They hug.) Sweetie you don’t have to worry. No, besides y’know what? I’m gonna have a lot of new things with you. The first time we buy a house. Our first kid. Our first grandkid…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Water! Water! Water!

content.description: Ross’s classroom, he has just finished his lecture and the students are filing out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh Mr. Morse, can I speak to you for a moment?

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: That was a great lecture today. Did you get a little hair cut?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-hmm, yeah-yeah do you like it? Do-do you looove it? I just want you to know that I’m changing your grade back.

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: What?! Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Cause I know what you’re trying to pull here. Okay? It’s not gonna work.

content.speaker: Morse
content.text: I’m not trying to pull anything. Look, I love you dude.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I-I’m not even gonna talk about this. Okay? This little thing is over. I know you have a girlfriend! Okay—(Ned looks shocked)—Yeah! And I know about the other professors! How do you think that makes me feel, Ned?! You used me! You don’t love me and you never did! (Ross turns around to make a grand exit but runs into two colleagues.) Ah Professor Winston, Professor Fredrickson, I’ll be right with you. (To Ned) Don’t make this worse and I’ll give you a C. (To the professors) Shall we? (They leave.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Phoebe is entering.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll be out in a second.
(Phoebe notices the Soapie on the counter.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. (Picks it up.) It’s just so unexpected! I…I uh…Boy I’ll tell you it’s just such an honor to be nominated for a Nobel Prize and y’know to win one for a massage. Especially after having just won a Tony award for best actress in…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, we have to go. Our reservations are at 8:00.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …in Reservations at 8:00 by Neil Simon. (To an imaginary Neil Simon) Thank-thank you Neil. Thank you for the words. (Blows him a kiss.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay honey, you can finish this later we’re gonna be late. We gotta go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please, don’t play the music. Just uh one more. LIVE FROM NEW YORK! IT’S SATURDAY NIGHT!!
